title: How to Delete All Spam Emails in Gmail: Complete Guide

steps.title: Log in to Gmail
steps.content: Log in to Gmail . Go to mail.google.com in your web browser and log in with your Gmail address and password. If you are already logged in to your account, move to the next step.

steps.title: Navigate to the Spam folder.
steps.content: Navigate to the Spam folder. To do that, click on More from the left side menu and select Spam from the drop-down list. Alternatively, type in:spam in the Gmail search bar and hit the Enter button.

steps.title: Click on the Delete all spam messages now link.
steps.content: Click on the Delete all spam messages now link. You can see this link at the top of the page.

steps.title: Confirm the deletion.
steps.content: Confirm the deletion. Click on the OK button from the pop-up confirmation box. Done!

steps.title: Launch the Gmail app on your device.
steps.content: Launch the Gmail app on your device. The Gmail icon looks like a white envelope with a red outline. You can find it on your home screen or Apps menu.

steps.title: Tap on the ≡ button.
steps.content: Tap on the ≡ button. You will see it on the top-left corner of the app. The menu panel will appear.

steps.title: Open the Spam tab.
steps.content: Open the Spam tab. Move to the All labels section and tap on the Spam option.

steps.title: Tap on EMPTY SPAM NOW.
steps.content: Tap on EMPTY SPAM NOW . Select EMPTY from the confirmation box to delete all spam emails from your account. Done!
